version_description: iOS 7.1 focus fix for iPhone 4

- DotCode Support - The Manatee Works Barcode Scanner SDK and the Barcode Scanners application are now the first products in our niche market to feature a state-of-the-art DotCode decoding engine;

- Added GS1 Code 128 support - Barcode Scanners will now detect any GS1 Code 128 code as a separate barcode type;

- Zoom support introduction - Zoom is now available by using the “Zoom” button or the pinching gesture;

- Full HD (1920 x 1080) resolution support added if available on device;

- Various bug fixes and performance enhancements.

- Multithreading support - number of CPU cores used for the decoding process can now be adjusted on the Settings page
- IATA 2 of 5 - Introduced support for the IATA implementation of the Interleaved 2 of 5 barcode type;
- Improved recognition of the GS1 DataBar Expanded barcode type

- Improved Data Matrix detection.
- Improved GS1 compliance.
Fixed crashing on iOS 7 devices
Updates to the integrated StingRay SDK to support saving profiles.

This exciting new release of Barcode Scanners offers a new interface, an even more powerful StingRay scanning experience, and shopper friendly features such as Web searching and History. We know you will appreciate all the great new features. Give them a try!
Various scanning performance enhancements thanks to our major SDK upgrade. Learn more at ManateeWorks.com

Based on feedback from our dedicated users, this version offers several new features, such as: an expanded limit to History and Favorites; multi-code sharing and export; device rotation support and much more. If you are a fan, please remember to rate us highly. For information about integrating the Manatee Works Barcode Scanner SDK into your apps, visit www.manateeworks.com.

Based on feedback from our dedicated users, this version offers several new features, such as: an expanded limit to History and Favorites; multi-code sharing and export; device rotation support and much more. If you are a fan, please remember to rate us highly. For information about integrating the Manatee Works Barcode Scanner SDK into your apps, visit www.manateeworks.com.

We are pleased to announce support for new symbologies MaxiCode, Postal Code, and Micro QR Code. We have also added parser support for Structured Carrier Messages (SCM), best known for being the standard specification of UPS. If you are a Manatee Works' fan, please remember to rate us highly. For information about integrating the Manatee Works Barcode Scanner SDK into your apps, visit www.manateeworks.com.
UPC and EAN bug fix.
Improvements to the Manatee Works Barcode Scanner SDK based on SDK version 3.1.2! For a description of those changes, please visit manateeworks.com.

This release incorporates improvements to the Manatee Works Barcode Scanner SDK based on SDK version 3.1.4. For a description of those changes, please visit www.manateeworks.com/changelog. Of most importance is our continued excellence at providing the best PDF417 scanning capability of any mobile software solution. Try it today!
Now featuring the power and flexibility of the Cognex Mobile Barcode Scanner SDK. To learn more, visit www.cognex.com/products/barcode-readers-scanners/mobile-solutions.

The Cognex Mobile Barcode SDK now fully assimilates the Manatee Works Barcode Scanner SDK. Beyond smartphones and mobile devices, the Cognex Mobile Barcode SDK also supports the MX-100 aimer case and the MX-1000 vision-enabled mobile terminal. Write one app... support universal hardware with Cognex!
Thanks to the great feedback from our customers, we are making the powerful MX-100 aimer case even better!
More features and improvements supporting our new aimer case, the MX-100.

With the launch of the revolutionary MX-100 barcode scanning device from Cognex, we have optimized and tune the Cognex Mobile Barcode SDK to take full advantage. Now experience even faster and more efficient scanning regardless of your industry or use case, with the Barcode Scanners app and a MX-100 device for iPhone or iPod. Learn more at cmbdn.cognex.com today!

- Improved Code 128 decoding
- Verify Barcode Location fixed

Improvements in decoder:
- Fixed Aztec code exceptions
- Updated GS1 parser for AI93
- Corrected identification of GS1 Dotcode
- FNC2 in GS1 Code 128 barcodes are now stripped (message append is not supported)
- Now supports 4:1 wide:narrow ratio for Codabar
Fix Code39 issue

- Improved Data Matrix and QR decoding
- New symbology added: TELEPEN
- Fixed wrong upper limit for decoder timeout

- Timestamp added to result history element
- Disabled MX-100 mode for unsupported devices
- Inverted logic for UPC and EAN Addons
- Fixed overall stability with MX-100

- Fixed performance issues.
- Fixed handling of PDF417 control codes
- Improved Aztec code decoding
- Improved 1D decoding for blurry images

- Support for character encodings (default UTF-8)
- Configure an initial zoom for small, challenging barcodes
- New Target Decoding feature for easier aiming and barcode selection
- Enhanced PDF417 decoding
- Removed favorites option from barcode history

- Added Auto encoding option to support barcodes which specify text encoding (e.g., some QR codes). If Encoding is set to Auto, the read result is decoded according to encoding information stored in the barcode or UTF8 otherwise
- Added a new encoding option to show non-printable characters as hex codes
- Sets Google as the default search engine if a custom one is removed
- Fixed tracking of illumination settings across successive scans
- Fixed missing value for initial zoom setting
- Improve overall stability
